page.title: 01Central Glen Muick
page.content: This area of great natural beauty is all privately owned & is split between estates,the river Muick (pronounced Mick),one of the bigger tributaries of the River Dee,being the dividing line. The Linn of Muick(a spectacular water- fall) provides a formidable obstacle for the salmon on their way up river.Much of the area is heavily wooded - mainly coniferous but some deciduous nearer to the river.The 3 highest points, the Coyles of Muick (601m),Craig of Loinmuie(540m) & Meall Dubh(563m) have grassy summits.There is some rough pasture near the river. The remainder of the area is moorland. There are 2 roads,one of which is private.The public road is narrow with passing places.There is a farmhouse occupied by the estate shepherd & his wife,& 3 other properties; housing a lady, a retired couple & 1 unoccupied.
